item.title: RunEnergy
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

If That Still Doesn’t Work Put The Player Energy Up To 999 On Character Profiles This Way You Can Choose Who Has Unlimited Energy And Who Doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: RunEnergy
item.dc:creator: @Mmmm_Java Mmmm Java
item.description:
@Mmmm_Java wrote:

change that code back to it was lol that doesnt work like you want it to. Look for this in your client.java

//Energy if (playerEnergy < 100) { if (playerEnergyGian >= server.EnergyRegian) { playerEnergy += 10; playerEnergyGian = 0; } playerEnergyGian++; if (playerEnergy >= 0) { WriteEnergy(); } }
and change it to this

//Energy if (playerEnergy < 100) playerEnergy=100;
and you’re done

Read full topic

item.title: RunEnergy
item.dc:creator: @cccrrraaazzziii cccrrraaazzziii
item.description:
@cccrrraaazzziii wrote:

Hey.

On my server, I have 0% Run, and so when I enter player.java, and edit the run to 9999, yet when I also change it to true and a update it, it doesn’t work.

// send "running packet" str.writeBits(2, 2); // updateType str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir1]); str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir2]); if(updateRequired) str.writeBits(1, 1); // tell client there's an update block appended at the end else str.writeBits(1, 0); if (playerEnergy > 9999) { playerEnergy -= 9999; } else { isRunning2 = true; stoprunning = true; }

Any ideas?

Read full topic
